abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Dar es Salaam Water
            Supply and Sanitation Project for Tanzania were as follows:
            outcomes were moderately unsatisfactory; the risk to
            development outcome was substantial; the Bank's
            performance was moderately unsatisfactory; and the
            Borrower's performance was also moderately
            unsatisfactory. Some lessons learned included: examine a
            wider range of factors affecting success. During project
            preparation and implementation there is a natural tendency
            to focus on the factors that are most visible. Take the
            concerns of a range of qualified potential bidders into
            account. Borrowers need to be diligent in assessing the
            market and developing strategies for attracting qualified
            bidders. Withdraw or change course when project related
            issues cannot be resolved satisfactorily. Perhaps the World
            Bank should have been more willing to withdraw from
            supporting the transaction and the project when the
            selection process did not progress in a constructive and
            transparent manner and afterwards, when the conditions to
            improve performance were not created. Develop contingency
            plans in event of termination of the private operator's
            contract. Develop rigorous systems and processes for
            reporting, monitoring, and collecting performance data.
            Ensure the effectiveness of performance bonds.
